comments:
This is with 3.1 M2 (I200409240800)

[BTW, I can't see "Version 3.1" in the Bugzilla bug entry form?]
After working for a while (debugging), the problem is gone.

Problem keeps coming back after a restart. The superclass of the class I want to
open the Type Hierarchy for is marked with "The type java.io.Serializable cannot
be resolved. It is indirectly referenced from required .class files", i.e. in my
class' sourcecode the superclass' name has a red squiggly underline. This
problem does not show up in the Problems View, and I can make it go away by
simply touching my class (insert a space somewhere) and recompiling. Afterwards,
the Type Hierarchy can be shown OK.

The JRE system library is configured properly for my project.

Many changes have been done in this area since 3.1 M2.
May you have a try with latest integration build or next week with 3.1 M3?
If this issue still happen, then reopen and provide more detailed example to
help us to reproduce, thanks
Closing as never reproduced in a long time
